results.title: First aid and safety: poisoning
results.brief_description: Shows how to make the home safe from poisons and uses animation to demonstrate first aid treatment for poison victims. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: First aid action
results.brief_description: Concentrates upon basic first aid steps. Simulated situations provide an opportunity to discuss and demonstrate mouth-to-mouth resuscitation, shock, bleeding, burns, fractures, poisoning and sudden illness. A recap is made of all first aid directions. Shots of real accidents provide realism which reinforce the film’s theme. Narrated by Burt Reynolds.

results.title: First adaptations
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Time to grow”.
Outlines the degree to which infants are “pre-adapted” to respond to their environment, to allow survival, growth and learning. Brain development is also demonstrated.

results.title: Firm foundations
results.creator_credit: Robin Hughes, Film Australia and Martin Cohen
results.brief_description: A film on preparing a case for finance. Frank Ryan is in need of money to expand his business. Frank is a builder, and his old schoolfriend Bill Scully is the local bank manager. Frank and Bill arrange a meeting to sign up Frank for a loan. But Frank discovers things are not all that simple. On the day they were to meet, Bill Scully suffers a heart attack and the finances of Frank’s biggest client are frozen. Now Frank must persuade the bank’s temporary manager to finance him. Credits include: script by Bob Ellis; edited by Sarah Bennett; sound by Howard Spry; photography by Andrew Fraser. Cast includes: Henri Szeps and Graeme Blundell.

results.title: Fireworks; Rabbit's Moon; Eaux D'artifice
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Anger Magick Lantern Cycle”.
Fireworks (1947, 14 min): A dissatisfied dreamer awakes, goes out in the night seeking a light, and is drawn through the needle’s eye. He returns to a bed less empty than before. “Rabbit’s Moon” (1950, 7 min): A fable of the unattainable (the Moon) combining elements of Commedia dell’arte with Japanese myth. A lunar dream utilising the classic pantomime figure of Pierrot in an encounter with aprankis, enchanted Magick Lantern. “Eaux D’Artifice” (1953, 13 min): Hide and seek in a night-time labyrinth of levels, cascades, balustrades, grottoes, and ever gushing leaping fountains, until the water witch and the fountain become one.

results.title: Firestorm
results.brief_description: In the aftermath of the fires that swept through Canberra in 2003, three teenagers contemplate their loss amongst the ashes and ruins of their suburbs. Exploring the impact of the devastation through their music, lives and loves, Firestorm is an intimate meditation on the fears, hopes and dreams of Australia’s largely unheard youth. Stylised images of the city combine with languid observations of the subjects to uncover the beauty that lies in the wake of the firestorm.

results.title: Fires within
results.creator_credit: Pathe Entertainment, Wallis Nicita, Lauren Lloyd and Gillian Armstrong
results.brief_description: When husband and wife Nestor (Jimmy Smits) and Isabel (Greta Scacchi) are reunited after Nestor is freed from jail for serving a 10 year term as a political prisoner they both find it hard to existence as husband and wife, living in Miami’s Little Havana. The community are eager for Nestor to resume his role as spokesperson for atrocities perpetrated by the Cuban government. His wife, Isabel (Greta Scacchi), does not want their lives or their families in Cuba sacrificed to the greater cause of freedom of expression. Isabel has also found love in the arms of the American fisherman who saved her and her daughter when they nearly drowned fleeing Cuba, and like her husband, she too must make a choice between her priorities as a lover, and as a wife and mother. Cast also includes Vincent D’Onofrio.

results.title: Fires of the mind: workings of the human brain
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Outlines findings of current research into the workings of the human brain - its anatomy and physiology, discoveries concerning its evolution and research into such areas as memory, the sense of self, and the human mind’s ability to reflect upon itself.

results.title: Fireman Sam
results.creator_credit: Bumper Film, Ian Frampton and John Walker
results.brief_description: Four stories featuring Fireman Sam and his friends in the town of Pontypandy narrated by John Alderton. The first story shows what happens when a trick is played on the fireman as a sticky substance is smeared on the fireman pole. There is a cat stuck up a tree in the second episode, a camping trip in the third and a special appearance on television by the Station Officer which excites the locals.
